channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024030609
item.description:
Report E-2024030609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 615000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on I 59 near Birmingham, AL. The driver lost control of the unit and went off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised and approximately 6000 gallons of gasoline was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024030522
item.description:
Report E-2024030522

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: VICKSBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K STORE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 150-gallons of gasoline were released impacting concrete and nearby soil. The spill occurred when the driver opened the drop head on his tanker trailer and accidentally overfilled it, causing approximately 150-gallons of gasoline to spill out. The driver deployed boom while waiting for assistance. The police and the fire department were notified and in route. The Fire Department responded and put down absorbents. The state of Mississippi was notified of the incident, but no report number could be provided by Catherine Bell. E3 Environmental arrived on site and swept-in absorbents solidifying released material on the impacted concrete. E3 Environmental scraped the surface of the impacted soil area and sprayed with microblaze. the impacted absorbents and soil were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report I-2024020031
item.description:
Report I-2024020031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: ELIZABETHTOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LEWIS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6310
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver pulled into rack to deliver product. While making turn, the driver caught a piece of angled iron from the rack right at the top of compartment #4 of the trailer. He did no realize what had happened and continued to position truck and trailer for delivery. This movement caused a rip in the inner and outer shell of the trailer allowing product to run out of the trailer. The fire dept. was called and they were able to put down booms immediately upon arrival and contain the product to the concrete apron and the oil/water separator/retention area under the trailer. The NRC was called, KY EPA was contacted along with, a spill response team for remediation and clean up. Lewis personnel responded as well to help coordinate delivery of product still in trailer and make sure clean up was done in timely manner.

  • Description: CNG Module (Quantum) involved in off road accident. Twelve of the fifty one cylinders released product due to the impact of the accident. In order to recover equipment remaining thirty-nine cylinders, a controlled vent to atmosphere occurred on each intact cylinders

item.title: Report X-2024030980

Report X-2024030980

  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 791418
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Liquid product released from unknown cause came into contact with wooden container floor resulting in an exothermic reaction within the closed space. Container exploded causing a release and burning of all product in 56 drums.

item.title: Report I-2023090164
item.description:
Report I-2023090164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-28T00:34:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: REED POINT
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MONTANA RAIL LINK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 06:15 on June 24th it was reported that a train derailment had occurred on a bridge and there were rail cars in the Yellowstone River. The westbound MLAUMIS1-23 derailed and Bridge 51 near Reed Point, MT failed and it was discovered 1 0 rail cars were in the river. The 10 cars in the river were 6 asphalt, 3 molten Sulphur and 1 loaded car of scrap metal. The cause of the accident is still under investigation.
